Title: Assign Azure Boards work items to Copilot coding agent in public preview
EnhancedContent:
[Copilot coding agent](https://github.blog/news-insights/product-news/github-copilot-meet-the-new-coding-agent/) is our asynchronous, autonomous developer agent. Delegate a task to Copilot, and Copilot will work in the background and create a draft pull request for your review.

You can hand tasks to Copilot from many places including GitHub Issues, Copilot Chat, the agents panel on every page on GitHub, and Raycast.

If you use Azure Boards for planning and tracking and store your code in GitHub, you can now assign work items to Copilot and track progress directly from Azure Boards.

To learn more and sign up for preview access for your team, follow the instructions on the [Azure DevOps Blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/azure-boards-integration-with-github-copilot-private-preview/).

To find out more about Copilot coding agent, head to [our documentation](https://gh.io/coding-agent-docs).
